column4: i think my upgrade to feisty destroyed all of my music.  Tons and tons and tons of music.
i had tons of stuff in /usr/share/ that feisty DESTROYED!!!
i wondered why my drive was so busy during my sunday rsync when i had no music added.
please don't use /usr/share for user data.
where did you find your music in the end?
it actually was in /usr/share/AUDIO but somehow the backup /backup/AUDIO was just ...gone.
I would still strongly recommend putting your music elsewhere. I would use /var/local/music or similar.
best way to restart alsa is to reboot
if that's not an option, 'sudo invoke-rc.d alsa-utils restart'
but still no little red laser light from my SPDIF cable. :(
